security: Recommending against the declassification of CD-971 to protect intelligence sources or methods. Mention of 'investigation of anonymous telephone call to the Canberra Embassy' suggests sensitive information.
summary: A memo from William H. Webster to the Director of Central Intelligence, via the Deputy Director for Plans, regarding a letter from Sir Charles Spry (ASIO) recommending against declassification of Warren Commission document CD-971.
summary_one_paragraph: On November 20, 1968, William H. Webster, Chief of the Far East Division, sent a memorandum to the Director of Central Intelligence, routed through the Deputy Director for Plans, concerning a letter from Sir Charles Spry, Director General of the Australian Security Intelligence Organization (ASIO). Sir Charles' letter advises against declassifying Warren Commission document CD-971, which pertains to the investigation of an anonymous telephone call made to the Canberra Embassy before and after President Kennedy's assassination. Webster concurs with Spry's recommendation and suggests withholding CD-971's declassification indefinitely, a view shared by the CI Staff.
title: Letter for Director from Sir Charles Spry (ASIO)
sender: William H. Webster (Chief, Far East Division)
